article: How to Play Monopoly: Easy Instructions to Get a Game Started
intro: Monopoly is a classic board game loved by people of all ages. But if you’ve never played before, you might need some help. Alternatively, you may simply need a quick refresher on the rules. In any case, we’re here to help! In this article, we’ll show you how to set up the board, play by the official rules, and end the game (hopefully at a reasonable time).

steps.title: Make deals with other players at any time.
steps.subtitle: Trading with other players is a key part of the strategy of any Monopoly game. This is usually how you obtain a monopoly to build houses and hotels.  Many players also have house rules that allow them to grant rent immunity to another player, lend money to another player, or borrow from the bank without mortgaging property.
sub-points: Do not include any house rules during your first game as including them can impact the enjoyment of the game and extend how long the game goes on for which isn't a good thing.

steps.title: Leave when you go bankrupt or keep playing until you win.
steps.subtitle: If you owe more money than you and your assets can afford, you're declared bankrupt and are out of the game. In official rules, your money and properties are given to the player who caused you to become bankrupt after selling all the buildings first.
sub-points: If you want a “fairer” house rule, auction off every player’s property instead of giving it to the person who caused them to go bankrupt.
Play continues until one player is left standing.
If you want a “fairer” house rule, auction off every player’s property instead of giving it to the person who caused them to go bankrupt.
